comment.author: 26220432@N06
comment._content:
** translation of describtion **

Second World War, landwar Eastern Front. A German soldier is using an odometer to calculate the right distance for the artillery fire. Russia/Soviet Union, 1941

comment.author: 78705066@N00
comment._content: Waffen SS trooper in distinctive camouflage smock manning a range finder.

comment.author: 26572034@N02
comment._content: The optical distance measuring device is called a theodolite. The Swiss Army used the same kind still in 1984 (when I did my miltary service).

comment.author: 31224416@N05
comment._content: This is an amazing collection of war photos...

comment.author: 14626411@N02
comment._content:
Translation in German (Amendment):

Übersetzung:
Zweiter Weltkrieg, Ostfront. Ein Deutscher Soldat misst für das Artilleriefeuer die Entfernung zum Ziel mit Hilfe eines Abstandsmessers.

comment.author: 78705066@N00
comment._content: "Entfernungsmesser" would be the correct German military term for the tool.

comment.author: 14626411@N02
comment._content: Thanks for this info. The translation is improving more and more :-)

comment.author: 48908968@N00
comment._content:
This soldier is from the Waffen SS., judging from the camoflage pattern.
Tough, professional and ruthless, either in battle or when used to terrorize civilian populations.
